name: Payment
description:
A relay of a transaction on an external chain that is considered a payment in a native currency.
 Various blockchains support different types of native payments. For each blockchain, it is specified how a payment
 transaction should be formed to be provable by this attestation type.
 The provable payments emulate traditional banking payments from entity A to entity B in native currency with an optional payment reference.
verification:
The transaction with `transactionId` is fetched from the API of the blockchain node or relevant indexer.
 If the transaction cannot be fetched or the transaction is in a block that does not have a sufficient [number of confirmations](/specs/attestations/configs.md#finalityconfirmation), the attestation request is rejected.
 Once the transaction is received, the [payment summary](/specs/attestations/external-chains/transactions.md#payment-summary) is computed according to the rules for the source chain.
 If the summary is successfully calculated, the response is assembled from the summary.
 `blockNumber` and `blockTimestamp` are retrieved from the block if they are not included in the transaction data.
 For Bitcoin and Dogecoin, `blockTimestamp` is mediantime of the block.
 For XRPL, `blockTimestamp` is close time of the ledger converted to UNIX time.
 If the summary is not successfully calculated, the attestation request is rejected.

params.name: transactionId
params.comment: ID of the payment transaction.

params.name: inUtxo
params.comment: For UTXO chains, this is the index of the transaction input with source address. Always 0 for the non-utxo chains.

params.name: utxo
params.comment: For UTXO chains, this is the index of the transaction output with receiving address. Always 0 for the non-utxo chains.

responseBody.name: ResponseBody
responseBody.description: Response body for Payment attestation type

params.name: blockNumber
params.comment: Number of the block in which the transaction is included.

params.name: blockTimestamp
params.comment: The timestamp of the block in which the transaction is included.

params.name: sourceAddressHash
params.comment: Standard address hash of the source address.

params.name: receivingAddressHash
params.comment: Standard address hash of the receiving address. The zero 32-byte string if there is no receivingAddress (if `status` is not success).

params.name: intendedReceivingAddressHash
params.comment: Standard address hash of the intended receiving address. Relevant if the transaction is unsuccessful.

params.name: spentAmount
params.comment: Amount in minimal units spent by the source address.

params.name: intendedSpentAmount
params.comment: Amount in minimal units to be spent by the source address. Relevant if the transaction status is unsuccessful.

params.name: receivedAmount
params.comment: Amount in minimal units received by the receiving address.

params.name: intendedReceivedAmount
params.comment: Amount in minimal units intended to be received by the receiving address. Relevant if the transaction is unsuccessful.

params.name: standardPaymentReference
params.comment: [Standard payment reference](/specs/attestations/external-chains/standardPaymentReference.md) of the transaction.

params.name: oneToOne
params.comment: Indicator whether only one source and one receiver are involved in the transaction.

params.name: status
params.comment: [Succes status](/specs/attestations/external-chains/transactions.md#transaction-success-status) of the transaction: 0 - success, 1 - failed by sender's fault,x  2 - failed by receiver's fault.
